content:
We are asking for topic suggestions, ideally for topics that you are willing to facilitate, but that is not required. We hoped to set up the events site so that you could schedule your own topics, but that is not likely to happen for this version of Backdrop LIVE.

Please, submit your topics here in Zulip. We'll put them on the schedule and confirm with you that the time work for you. Adjusts can me made afterwards.

I'd love to see a session on the state of CiviCRM/Backdrop integration. There are some modules that are unique to backdrop, I'd love to see Laryn demo some/talk about direction. Is there anyone that can do a basic overview of where things are at? Maybe Jack?

Our goal is that if anyone wants to do a formal structured presentation that they record it in advance and we schedule the discussion for Backdrop LIVE.

Backdrop LIVE sessions should focus on the discussion part and/or interactive demonstrations.

I think we have previously recorded presentations on Backdrop and CiviCRM (within the last few months). We could use those as the recorded presentation (if anyone wants to review them) and then use the session to talk about any new developments, questions and answers, etc.
that sounds smart

I tentatively scheduled a CiviCRM discussion for slot #5. Please suggest a change if you like.
http://bit.ly/3e5zfrN

Rewrite README.txt 路 Issue #5 路 backdrop/backdrop-issues
We should rewrite README.txt. As we're on Github, it should be a .md file to increase the readability for users visiting the project for the first time. We should cover our main goals briefly (...
Backdrop LIVE Schedule
Sheet1 Short link to this document: <a href="http://bit.ly/3e5zfrN">http://bit.ly/3e5zfrN</a> Anyone can suggest a topic for the schedule. Contact us in Zulip or on the <a href="http://events.backdropcms.org/">events.backdropcms.org</a> site to request a topic. Please, select a time slot that wo...

If it would be of any use, I could do a 5 min thing on how I finally dove in and setup my first backdrop site (which is all of 3 nodes and 2 blocks) that would leave everyone with more questions than answers but at least help newbies figure out what the questions are. not sure if it would be useful or not. depends on how many folks show up that know less than I do ;)

Here is the recording: YouTube - Backdrop CMS and CiviCRM
@Laryn or someone else could possibly say what has changed since then (if anything) and discussion could carry on from there.

We need a facilitator for the CiviCMR discussion. Anyone?

We can change the time slot to accommodate whoever is willing to facilitate. http://bit.ly/3e5zfrN

Backdrop LIVE Schedule
Sheet1 Short link to this document: <a href="http://bit.ly/3e5zfrN">http://bit.ly/3e5zfrN</a> Anyone can suggest a topic for the schedule. Contact us in Zulip or on the <a href="http://events.backdropcms.org/">events.backdropcms.org</a> site to request a topic. Please, select a time slot that wo...
@ericfg - Would you be willing to facilitate this one (CiviCRM) and hopefully @Laryn and/or @Herb will be able to help out?
I'm just catching up on this and sorting out my own attendance. If @ericfg would rather not facilitate a CiviCRM discussion, I'd be happy to!
I think Jack would be a better choice but I'm around if needed.
@ericfg @Jack - Sounds great!

@Jack - Let me know if the time slot works for you or if you would prefer another.
The schedule is still flexible and moving.
@jenlampton and I are both hoping that someone will facilitate a Freelancer Roundtable, to talk about running a freelance business and working with Backdrop. Anyone?
@StPaulTim I think the convo is currently in Slot 5, 1pm PT, Friday March 12? If that's correct, then that works for me!

Yes, the CiviCRM is currently scheduled at 1:00pm Pacific time. We'll leave it there since that works for you.
Thanks.

Yeah, I will be doing the mid-night slot for those of you in American Westcoast time. Aka Vancouver/LA. HOPEFULLY my stream will go ok, since I am sharing from China. Ill make sure I have a backup online and ready on youtube. I decided to pre-record it but be available to chat if anyone is awake :D
My talk is going to be on ADA (American Disabilitys Act) compliance and general accessibility.

Which, is if you didnt know, a pretty hot topic in web development for the obvious reason (such as people need accessible websites), but also because many lawsuits have been happening against businesses in the US that don't have compliant websites.
Therefore you are doing your clients a disservice if you are not getting them ADA compliant and in the US from the start!
(There is no time like now to begin).
You can get most of done in just 1 hour!!! <--- this is my talk
@Eric Vander Wal that was an awesome pitch for your talk!
I'm in Oakland CA so I don't think I can make the midnight slot. :) But I look forward to watching it!
Aw, thanks. I have about 8 clients in a row right now that are all about ADA compliance (one day jobs mostly). So I am in the thick of it right now. Seems like the right time to give the talk :)

Checkout out the current schedule and add your topic to the sheet.
http://bit.ly/3e5zfrN
